content: Digital Services | San Francisco Skip to main content English Español 中文 Filipino Part of City Administrator Digital Services We transform how residents interact with the City by building services designed around the people that use them. “Sunset over City Hall” by Sergio Ruiz , CC BY Digital Accessibility and Inclusion Standard From November 2021, all new City websites, online applications, and digital content are required to: Follow SF's equitable design requirements Write all vital information at or below a 5th grade level Translate all vital information by humans Read more Events There are no upcoming events right now. View past events Resources Digital Services blog Read more about our work and latest updates. Participate in research Help us improve government services. Anyone who lives or works in San Francisco is eligible to participate. Digital Services Strategy From 2016, a roadmap for how SF can use digital to redesign City services to be accessible and easy to use. About San Francisco Digital Services works with other City departments to improve public services. We’re re-thinking how public services are designed, by understanding what our users need and building with an agile approach. We're working on critical issues like affordable housing and building permits . Learn more about us Related DataSF People Staff 1788, Cyd Harrell Chief Digital Services Officer 1788, Jane Gong Deputy Chief Digital Services Officer Contact Digital Services 1 Van Ness Ave, 2nd Floor San Francisco, CA 94103 Get directions Request public records Email DigitalServicesSunshine@sfgov.org to submit a request.
